milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Items to be considered in future releases that are currently not assigned any specific milestone.

issue.title: Update view compilation error message
issue.body:
After encountering dotnet/sdk#120, I noticed that the error message had not been updated to the MSBuild project system from ```project.json```.

This PR updates the error message for the latest SDK.

comment.body: Yeah, I wasn't exactly sure what the replacement wording should be. I'll update the PR with different text once you've got a decided alternative.

issue.title: Update view compilation error message
issue.body:
After encountering dotnet/sdk#120, I noticed that the error message had not been updated to the MSBuild project system from ```project.json```.

This PR updates the error message for the latest SDK.

comment.body:
Should it say "... in the project file." instead of specifying "csproj" since views are not really not tied to the C# project system? Also, should we encourage users to use the Web.Sdk? Might not apply in your scenario, but in general it's what we'd expect most users to use and that would set this property up for you.

cc @Eilon

issue.title: Regression since 1.1.x with ComplexTypeModelBinder
issue.body:
Hi,

I updated Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc package to 1.1.1 and since, our application does not work correctly cause of the ComplexTypeModelBinder.

It checks for default constructor of my view model and also its nested properties.

In my case, I have kind of following structure
->View
---->ViewModel (no default constructor cause i need dependencies from service provider)
-------> Entity1 (no default constructor cause i need dependencies from service provider)
-------> Entity2 (no default constructor cause i need dependencies from service provider)

It's not compatible with modifications you brought with 1.1.0, 1.1.1 and even with the fix #5698 

Please fix this bug cause it means that you don't allow dependency injection for models...

Thanks

comment.body:
@marcusien we would love to see your code sample if you can upload it to GitHub. What I meant in my first message is that we changed how we fixed #5698 so better support the scenario we think you're describing.

In the meantime, @kichalla tried out some similar scenarios on the latest 1.1.1 preview build and he didn't have any issues.

issue.title: Consume new Microsoft.AspNet.WebApi.Client.5.2.4 package
issue.body:
Our Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.WebApiCompatShim package currently has an indirect dependency on the Microsoft.Net.Http package. Building the shim project requires imports when targeting .NET Standard for the same reason. Both issues could be avoided if we moved to the latest Microsoft.AspNet.WebApi.Client package.

See also
- #5562, an older report of related problems
- aspnet/AspNetWebStack#45, tracking publishing the Microsoft.AspNet.WebApi.Client v5.2.4 package for realz
- aspnet/AspNetWebStack#4, which covered adding .NET Standard 1.1. support to the Microsoft.AspNet.WebApi.Client package
- the current [Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.WebApiCompatShim package](https://dotnet.myget.org/feed/aspnetcore-ci-dev/package/nuget/Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.WebApiCompatShim)
- the current [Microsoft.AspNet.WebApi.Client package](https://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.AspNet.WebApi.Client/)
- the new [Microsoft.AspNet.WebApi.Client package](https://www.myget.org/feed/aspnetwebstacknightly/package/nuget/Microsoft.AspNet.WebApi.Client)

comment.body: We should talk about how to do the release and see if we can just do that.

cc @pranavkm

issue.title: Null Reference Exception from ControllerActionInvoker Middleware
issue.body:
An unhandled exception occurs very rarely in this WebApp hosted in Kestrel.  
I have attached a section of the stacktrace -  anything in between is just rethrowing of the exception.

Please let me know if this is an issue inside Mvc or if I should be handling it elsewhere.

```
 Microsoft.AspNetCore.Diagnostics.ExceptionHandlerMiddleware
	An unhandled exception has occurred: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
	System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
    at lambda_method(Closure , Object , Object[] )    
	at Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Internal.ControllerActionInvoker.<InvokeActionMethodAsync>d__27.MoveNext() 
	--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
    at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.ThrowForNonSuccess(Task task)    
	at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)    
	at Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Internal.ControllerActionInvoker.<InvokeNextActionFilterAsync>d__25.MoveNext() 
	--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---    
	at Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Internal.ControllerActionInvoker.Rethrow(ActionExecutedContext context)    
	at Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Internal.ControllerActionInvoker.Next(State& next, Scope& scope, Object& state, Boolean& isCompleted)    
	at Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Internal.ControllerActionInvoker.<InvokeNextResourceFilter>d__22.MoveNext() 
	--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---    
	at Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Internal.ControllerActionInvoker.Rethrow(ResourceExecutedContext context)    
	at Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Internal.ControllerActionInvoker.Next(State& next, Scope& scope, Object& state, Boolean& isCompleted)    
	at Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Internal.ControllerActionInvoker.<InvokeAsync>d__20.MoveNext() 
	--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---    
	at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.ThrowForNonSuccess(Task task)    
	at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)    
	at Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.RouterMiddleware.<Invoke>d__4.MoveNext() 
	--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---   
```

...more stuff...

```
 --- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---    
	at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.ThrowForNonSuccess(Task task)    
	at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)    
	at Microsoft.AspNetCore.Diagnostics.ExceptionHandlerMiddleware.<Invoke>d__6.MoveNext()Null'
```

comment.body: Actually, I spaced on this part `lambda_method(Closure , Object , Object[] )` - that's the generated expression thunk we use to call the controller method.

issue.title: Razor Precompilation fails
issue.body:
According to [the only source](http://dotnetthoughts.net/compile-your-aspnet-core-mvc-views/) (of unclear reputation) I could find on the web about ASP.NET Core view compilation (#3917), I have added the following to my ASP.NET Core project.json file:

	"tools": {
		"Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Razor.ViewCompilation.Tools": {
			"version": "1.1.0-preview4-final"
		}
	},

I also updated a lot of the standard NuGet packages, until I ran into trouble with some IIS tools package which eventually disappeared completely. No idea what's going on there. It's a completely new project, just created with VS 2015 Update 3.

This is what I get when I run `dotnet publish`:

```
D:\Projekte\Tests\AspCorePluginDemo\src\AspCorePluginDemo>dotnet publish
Publishing AspCorePluginDemo for .NETFramework,Version=v4.6/win7-x64
No executable found matching command "dotnet-bundle"
Project AspCorePluginDemo (.NETFramework,Version=v4.6) will be compiled because inputs were modified
Compiling AspCorePluginDemo for .NETFramework,Version=v4.6

Compilation succeeded.
    0 Warning(s)
    0 Error(s)

Time elapsed 00:00:01.2814419


The specified framework 'Microsoft.NETCore.App', version '1.1.0' was not found.
  - Check application dependencies and target a framework version installed at:
      C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App
  - The following versions are installed:
      1.0.0
      1.0.0-rc2-3002702
      1.0.1
  - Alternatively, install the framework version '1.1.0'.
No executable found matching command "dotnet-publish-iis"
publish: Published to D:\Projekte\Tests\AspCorePluginDemo\src\AspCorePluginDemo\bin\Debug\net46\win7-x64\publish
Published 1/1 projects successfully
```

Some lines are in red.

When I start the published application .exe anyway and try to access the main page, this happens in the console output:

```
fail: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.ViewFeatures.Internal.ViewResultExecutor[3]

      /Views/Home/Index.cshtml
      /Views/Shared/Index.cshtml
System.InvalidOperationException: The view 'Index' was not found. The following locations were searched:
/Views/Home/Index.cshtml
/Views/Shared/Index.cshtml
   bei Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.ViewEngines.ViewEngineResult.EnsureSuccessful(IEnumerable`1 originalLocations)

--- Ende der Stapelüberwachung vom vorhergehenden Ort, an dem die Ausnahme ausgelöst wurde ---
```

commits.message:
Bump test projects up to .NET 4.5.2
- aspnet/Testing#248
- xUnit no longer supports .NET 4.5.1
- update AppVeyor config so this framework version is available
- build tests for desktop .NET only on Windows

issue.title: rewrite middleware not identifying multiple slashes
issue.body:
Problem : Redirect to url with single slash if url has multiple slashes.

http://localhost/segment1///segment2//segment3

The above url when read removes multiple slashes and shows only one slash.
I tried following methods to read url.

request.Path
Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Extensions.UriHelper.GetEncodedUri (request)
Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Extensions.UriHelper.GetDisplayUri(request)

Thanks.
